item.title: Some interesting open source project
item.description:
M·ª•c l·ª•c

Sometime we found some interesting projects, we had dug and enjoy them during a time. But time fly, and we forgot it. So i build this post to note them.

[29-01-2023] benfred/py-spy

Language Python3
Type Analytics
Link https://github.com/benfred/py-spy

py-spy is a sampling profiler for Python programs. It lets you visualize what your Python program is spending time on without restarting the program or modifying the code in any way. py-spy is extremely low overhead: it is written in Rust for speed and doesn‚Äôt run in the same process as the profiled Python program. This means py-spy is safe to use against production Python code.

py-spy works on Linux, OSX, Windows and FreeBSD, and supports profiling all recent versions of the CPython interpreter (versions 2.3-2.7 and 3.3-3.10).

item.title: Service Locator Pattern
item.description:
M·ª•c l·ª•c

  1. Service Locator Pattern l√† g√¨ ?
  2. C√†i ƒë·∫∑t Service Locator nh∆∞ th·∫ø n√†o ?
  3. Code
  4. ∆Øu ƒëi·ªÉm vs nh∆∞·ª£c ƒëi·ªÉm ?
  5. Use case ƒëi·ªÉn h√¨nh.

Service Locator Pattern l√† g√¨ ?

Service Locator l√† m·ªôt pattern cho ph√©p client c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë·ªãnh v·ªã nh·ªØng service m√† n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng. B·∫±ng c√°ch t√°ch r·ªùi m·ªëi li√™n h·∫øt gi·ªØa class v·ªõi c√°c dependencies (hay g·ªçi l√† services) c·ªßa n√≥ th√¥ng qua vi·ªác chen v√†o gi·ªØa m·ªëi li√™n k·∫øt m·ªôt ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng trung gian l√† Service Locator

üö© Th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng th√¨ Service Locator Pattern ƒë∆∞·ª£c k·∫øt h·ª£p v·ªõi Factory Pattern ho·∫∑c Dependency Injection Pattern ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o ra c√°c instance c·ªßa service

C√†i ƒë·∫∑t Service Locator nh∆∞ th·∫ø n√†o?

Class Diagram

V·ªõi diagram nh∆∞ tr√™n ta c√≥ th·ªÉ hi·ªÉu flow ƒë·ªÉ setup m·ªôt Service Locator nh∆∞ sau:

  1. Client th·ª±c hi·ªán nghi·ªáp v·ª• v√† g·ªçi v√†o ServiceLocator ƒë·ªÉ l·∫•y service c·∫ßn d√πng (hay dependency c·∫ßn d√πng)
  2. ServiceLocator check trong Cache xem service ƒë√≥ ƒë√£ c√≥ trong Cache ch∆∞a ?
  3. N·∫øu c√≥ th√¨ tr·∫£ v·ªÅ service c·∫ßn d√πng.
  4. N·∫øu kh√¥ng th√¨ ti·∫øp t·ª•c:
    • G·ªçi v√†o InitialContext ƒë·ªÉ kh·ªüi t·∫°o service
    • InitialContext th√¥ng quan interface Service ƒë·ªÉ l·∫•y instance c·ªßa ServiceImpl theo c√°c th√¥ng s·ªë
    • Tr·∫£ v·ªÅ service instance cho ServiceLocator
    • V√† song song ƒë√≥, cache l·∫°i service trong Cache

üö© Note : ServiceLocator lu√¥n l√† Singleton , tr√°nh racing condition.

CODE

Code on GitHub

ƒê·∫ßu ti√™n ta kh·ªüi t·∫°o m·ªôt interface Service v√† ServiceImpl. Trong ServiceImpl, inject 2 th√¥ng s·ªë l√† serviceName v√† id

Interface Service.java

// Service.java
// [Interface]

public interface Service {
  // the human-readable name of the service
  String getName();

  // UniqueID of the particular service
  int getId();

  // The workflow method that defines what this service does
  void execute();
}

Class ServiceImpl.java

// ServiceImpl.java
// [Class]
import lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;

@Slf4j
public class ServiceImpl implements Service{

  private final String serviceName;
  private final int id;

  // Constructor
  public ServiceImpl(String serviceName) {
    this.serviceName = serviceName;
    this.id = (int) Math.floor(Math.random() * 1000) + 1;
  }

  @Override
  public String getName() {
    return this.serviceName;
  }

  @Override
  public int getId() {
    return this.id;
  }

  @Override
  public void execute() {
    log.info("Service {} is now executing with id {}", getName(), getId());
  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    ServiceImpl a = new ServiceImpl("test");
    a.execute();
  }
}

Kh·ªüi t·∫°o class InitContext.java

// InitContext.java
// Class
import lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;

@Slf4j
public class InitContext {

  /**
   * Perform the lookup based on the service name.
   * The return object will need to be cast into a {@link Service}
   *
   * @param serviceName: a name
   * @return : an {@link Service}
   */
  public ServiceImpl lookup(String serviceName) {
    if ("serviceA".equals(serviceName)) {
      log.info("Looking up service A and creating new service for A");
      return new ServiceImpl("serviceA");
    } else if ("serviceB".equals(serviceName)) {
      log.info("Looking up service B and creating new service for B");
      return new ServiceImpl("serviceB");
    } else {
      return null;
    }
  }
}

ServiceCache.java

// ServiceCache.java
// Class
import lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;
import lombok.var;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

@Slf4j
public class ServiceCache {
  private final Map<String, Service> serviceCache;

  public ServiceCache() {
    this.serviceCache = new HashMap<>();
  }

  /**
   * Get the service from cache. null if no service is found matching the name
   *
   * @param serviceName: a string
   * @return {@link Service}
   */
  public Service getService(String serviceName) {
    if (serviceCache.containsKey(serviceName)) {
      var cacheService = serviceCache.get(serviceName);
      var name = cacheService.getName();
      var id = cacheService.getId();
      log.info("(cache call) Fetched service {}({}) from cache ...!", name, id);
      return cacheService;
    } else {
      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Adds the service into the cache map.
   *
   * @param newService: a {@link Service}
   */
  public void addService(Service newService) {
    serviceCache.put(newService.getName(), newService);
  }
}

R·ªìi b√¢y gi·ªù k·∫øt h·ª£p service v√† cache l·∫°i ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ ServiceLocator.java

// ServiceLocator.java
// Class
import lombok.var;

import java.util.Objects;

public class ServiceLocator {
  private static final ServiceCache serviceCache = new ServiceCache();

  private ServiceLocator(){}

  /**
   * Fetch the service with the name param from the cache first,
   * if no service is found, lookup the service from the {@link InitContext}
   * and then add the newly created service into the cache map
   * for future request
   *
   * @param serviceName: astring
   * @return {@link Service}
   */
  public static Service getService(String serviceName) {
    var serviceObj = serviceCache.getService(serviceName);

    if (Objects.isNull(serviceObj)) {
      /*
       * If we are unable to retrieve anything from cache, then lookup the service
       * and add it in the cache map
       */
      var ctx = new InitContext();
      serviceObj = ctx.lookup(serviceName);
      if (Objects.nonNull(serviceObj)) { // Only cache a service if it actually exists
        serviceCache.addService(serviceObj);
      }
    }
    return serviceObj;
  }
}

Th·ª≠ nghi·ªám build m·ªôt client ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y th·ª≠ App.java

// App.java
// CLass
import lombok.var;

public class App {
  public static final String JNDI_SERVICE_A = "serviceA";
  public static final String JNDI_SERVICE_B = "serviceB";

  // Program entry point
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    var service = ServiceLocator.getService(JNDI_SERVICE_A);
    service.execute();
    service = ServiceLocator.getService(JNDI_SERVICE_B);
    service.execute();
    service = ServiceLocator.getService(JNDI_SERVICE_A);
    service.execute();
    service = ServiceLocator.getService(JNDI_SERVICE_A);
    service.execute();
  }
}

Run it !!!!!

üö© Note : R√µ r√†ng ·ªü ƒë√¢y t·∫ßng InitContext ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ªëi ∆∞u, m·ªói khi th√™m m·ªôt service X v√†o system, code s·∫Ω ph·∫£i thay ƒë·ªïi ƒë·ªÉ th√™m d·ªãch v·ª•. CH·ªó n√†y c√°c b·∫°n c√≥ th·ªÉ tham kh·∫£o c√°ch code Reflection ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h∆°n.

∆Øu ƒëi·ªÉm vs nh∆∞·ª£c ƒëi·ªÉm ?

∆Øu ƒëi·ªÉm:

  • Qu·∫£n l√Ω t·∫≠p trung c√°c service th√¥ng qua ServiceLocator duy nh·∫•t (Singleton)
  • ·ª®ng d·ª•ng chia ra c√°c ph·∫ßn √≠t b·ªã r·∫±ng bu·ªôc (loose coupling) v·ªõi nhau. D·ªÖ code, qu·∫£n l√Ω h∆°n.
  • T√°ch r·ªùi class v·ªõi c√°c dependencies c·ªßa n√≥, nh·ªù ƒë√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ thay th·∫ø c√°c dependency t·∫°i th·ªùi ƒëi·ªÉm run-time m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ph·∫£i re-compile hay ph·∫£i restart ·ª©ng d·ª•ng
  • D·ªÖ test h∆°n do c√°c class kh√¥ng c√≤n b·ªã ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o dependencies

Nh∆∞·ª£c ƒëi·ªÉm:

  • Kh√≥ debug h∆°n, v√¨ c√°c dependencies tr·ªü th√†nh hidden ƒë·ªëi v·ªõi class
  • ServiceLocator l√† duy nh·∫•t => ngh·∫Ωn c·ªï chai
  • C√≥ th·ªÉ s·∫Ω g·∫∑p l·ªói tr√™n run-time m√† kh√¥ng g·∫∑p khi compile-time do c√°c service b·ªã ·∫©n ƒëi
  • Service Locator Pattern kh√≥ maintain h∆°n Dependency Injection Pattern. Do c√°c concrete class v·∫´n c√≥ ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o ServiceLocator, trong khi ƒë√≥ DI ch·ªâ d·ªçi m·ªôt l·∫ßn ƒë√™ inject c√°c dependencies v√†o l·ªõp ch√≠nh.=> DI d·ªÖ vi·∫øt Unit Test h∆°n.

Use Case

  • Khi c·∫ßn t√°ch r·ªùi m·ªôt class v·ªõi c√°c dependencies c·ªßa n√≥.
  • Khi c·∫ßn qu·∫£n l√Ω t·∫≠p trung vi·ªác kh·ªüi t·∫°o c√°c Service

L·ªùi k·∫øt

Service Locator l√† m·ªôt c√°ch th·ª±c hi·ªán IoC Container. Khi ƒë·ªçc Spring ta s·∫Ω g·∫∑p r·∫•t nhi·ªÅu kh√°i ni·ªám Dependency Inverrsion trong SOLID, IoC Container, DI container ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ C√°c b √†i vi·∫øt s·∫Øp t·ªõi s·∫Ω vi·∫øt v·ªÅ c√°c thu·∫≠t ng·ªØ n√†y.

item.title: Sample Page
item.description:
Text can be bold, italic, strikethrough or keyword.

Link to another page.

There should be whitespace between paragraphs.

There should be whitespace between paragraphs. We recommend including a README, or a file with information about your project.

Header 1

This is a normal paragraph following a header. GitHub is a code hosting platform for version control and collaboration. It lets you and others work together on projects from anywhere.

Header 2

This is a blockquote following a header.

When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

Header 3

// Javascript code with syntax highlighting.
var fun = function lang(l) {
  dateformat.i18n = require('./lang/' + l)
  return true;
}

# Ruby code with syntax highlighting
GitHubPages::Dependencies.gems.each do |gem, version|
  s.add_dependency(gem, "= #{version}")
end

Header 4

  • This is an unordered list following a header.
  • This is an unordered list following a header.
  • This is an unordered list following a header.
Header 5
  1. This is an ordered list following a header.
  2. This is an ordered list following a header.
  3. This is an ordered list following a header.
Header 6
head1 head two three
ok good swedish fish nice
out of stock good and plenty nice
ok good oreos hmm
ok good zoute drop yumm

There‚Äôs a horizontal rule below this.

Here is an unordered list:

  • Item foo
  • Item bar
  • Item baz
  • Item zip

And an ordered list:

  1. Item one
  2. Item two
  3. Item three
  4. Item four

And a nested list:

  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
      • level 3 item
      • level 3 item
  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
  • level 1 item
    • level 2 item
    • level 2 item
  • level 1 item

Small image

Large image

Definition lists can be used with HTML syntax.

Name
Godzilla
Born
1952
Birthplace
Japan
Color
Green
Long, single-line code blocks should not wrap. They should horizontally scroll if they are too long. This line should be long enough to demonstrate this.

The final element.

Some icon:

üö© Red Flag

item.title: Create Blog use Github and Jekyll on MacOS
item.description:
M·ª•c l·ª•c

  1. M·ª•c ti√™u
  2. Step need to do
    • Step 1 - Upgrade ruby 3.1.3
    • Step 2 - gem install jekyll
    • Step 3 - create first project t·ª´ jekyll
    • Step 4 - pick a theme in: https://jamstackthemes.dev/ssg/jekyll/page/4/
    • Step 5 - add SSH and pull project by SSH : https://www.theserverside.com/blog/Coffee-Talk-Java-News-Stories-and-Opinions/GitHub-SSH-Key-Setup-Config-Ubuntu-Linux
    • Step 6 - setup public Page in github: https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/configuring-a-publishing-source-for-your-github-pages-site
    • Step 7 - remove repository name in github link: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44531269/is-there-a-way-to-remove-repository-name-from-github-page-link

M·ª•c ti√™u

G·∫ßn cu·ªëi nƒÉm, m√¨nh c√≥ kh√° nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·ªçc v√† t√¨m hi·ªÉu. Nh∆∞ng v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ n·∫£y sinh l√† :

  1. M√¨nh ƒë·ªçc kh√° nhi·ªÅu nh∆∞ng c≈©ng qu√™n kh√° nhi·ªÅu
  2. C·∫ßn m·ªôt n∆°i t·ªïng h·ª£p l·∫°i nh·ªØng th·ª© m√¨nh ƒë√£ b·ªè c√¥ng ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m hi·ªÉu, ti·∫øt ki·ªám th·ªùi gian t√¨m t√≤i v√† v·ªçc
  3. M·ªôt v√†i ng∆∞·ªùi th√¢n c≈©ng c·∫ßn n·ªÅn t·∫£ng n√†o ƒë√≥ ƒë·ªÉ vi·∫øt blog cho ch√≠nh h·ªç

A h√°, m√¨nh c√≥ √Ω t∆∞·ªüng n√†y. Github h·ªó tr·ª£ blog c√° nh√¢n kh√° ngon th·∫•y nhi·ªÅu ng∆∞·ªùi c≈©ng d√πng. Th·ª≠ t√¨m hi·ªÉu v√† b·∫Øt tay v√†o x√¢y d·ª±ng trang c√° nh√¢n th·ª≠ xem

What do we need to do ?

Sau m·ªôt h·ªìi ƒë·ªçc vs ngh·ªãch th√¨ m√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞a blog l√™n ƒë∆∞·ª£c. V√† c√°c step nh∆∞ d∆∞·ªõi ƒë√¢y.

Step 0 - Prerequisites

  • github account
  • MacOS (V√¨ m√¨nh d√πng Mac n√™n m√¨nh t·ªïng h·ª£p c√°c step tr√™n Mac, c√≤n c√°c OS kh√°c nh∆∞ Linux, Win,.. th√¨ v·ªÅ c∆° b·∫£n c≈©ng na n√°. B·∫°n ƒë·ªçc t·ª± t√¨m hi·ªÉu)
  • ƒê√£ c√†i Homebrew

Step 1 - Upgrade ruby 3.1.3

Source: https://mac.install.guide/ruby/13.html

Check Ruby version

Run this shell

$ which ruby
/usr/bin/ruby
$ ruby -v
ruby 2.6.3p62 (2019-04-16 revision 67580) [....]
Install Ruby
$ brew install ruby
Config the shell environment

Edit the ~/.zshrc file in your text editor.

$ vim ~/.zshrc

Setup in the end of file

On Mac Intel

# Setup $PATH for ruby
if [ -d "/usr/local/opt/ruby/bin" ]; then
  export PATH=/usr/local/opt/ruby/bin:$PATH
  export PATH=`gem environment gemdir`/bin:$PATH
fi

on Mac Silicon:

# Setup $PATH for ruby
if [ -d "/opt/homebrew/opt/ruby/bin" ]; then
  export PATH=/opt/homebrew/opt/ruby/bin:$PATH
  export PATH=`gem environment gemdir`/bin:$PATH
fi

Save file.

üö© Note: Close and reopen the Terminal window for the changes to the ~/.zshrc file to be recognized

Confirm Ruby installation
$ ruby -v
ruby 3.1.3p185 (2022-11-24 revision 1a6b16756e) [arm64-darwin20]

$ echo $PATH
/opt/homebrew/lib/ruby/gems/3.1.0/bin:/opt/homebrew/opt/ruby/bin:/Users/anryseig/opt/anaconda3/bin:/Users/anryseig/opt/anaconda3/condabin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/opt/homebrew/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin

Step 2 - gem install jekyll

Step 3 - create first project t·ª´ jekyll

V·ªÅ c∆° b·∫£n th√¨ Step 2 + Step 3 follow DOC c·ªßa https://jekyllrb.com/docs/ ƒë·ªÉ install v√† run th·ª≠ m·ªôt project t·∫°o t·ª´ jekyll.

$ gem install jekyll
$ jekyll new myblog
$ cd myblog
$ bundle exec jekyll serve
....
    Server address: http://127.0.0.1:4000/

V√¥ link server tr√™n v√† b·∫°n ƒë√£ access v√†o blog c·ªßa b·∫°n. Ch√∫c m·ª´ng, b·∫°n ƒë√£ th√†nh c√¥ng kh·ªüi t·∫°o blog c√° nh√¢n c·ªßa b·∫°n ·ªü m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng local.

Step 4 - Pick a theme

ƒê·ªÉ r√∫t g·ªçn th·ªùi gian v√† t·∫≠p trung v√†o vi·ªác ƒë∆∞a trang blog c√° nh√¢n c·ªßa b·∫°n v√†o lu·ªìng ch·∫°y, h√£y ch·ªçn m·ªôt theme th√≠ch h·ª£p v·ªõi b·∫°n ·ªü ƒë√¢y: https://jamstackthemes.dev/ssg/jekyll/

Pull theme m√† b·∫°n ch·ªçn v√† ƒë·ªçc qua c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng theme ƒë√≥.

üö© Note: T·ªõi ƒë√¢y th√¨ v·ªÅ c∆° b·∫£n b·∫°n ƒë√£ t·∫°o ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ th·ªÉ ch·∫°y jekyll project. V·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ti·∫øp theo l√† tri·ªÉn khai project t·ª´ m√°y c·ªßa b·∫°n l√™n m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng Internet. ·ªû ƒë√¢y ch√∫ng ta l·ª±a ch·ªçn n·ªÅn t·∫£ng github ƒë·ªÉ tri·ªÉn khai blog c·ªßa m√¨nh.

Step 5 - Add SSH and pull project by SSH

Github thay ƒë·ªïi security policy v√† b·∫Øt ch√∫ng ta pull/push project qua ssh. N√™n b·∫°n c·∫ßn setup SSH config v√† pull project v·ªõi SSH key ƒë√≥.

Plz follow the below link: GitHub-SSH-Key-Setup-Config-Ubuntu-Linux

Step 6 - Setup public Page in github

T·ªõi ƒë√¢y th√¨ v·ªÅ c∆° b·∫£n b·∫°n ƒë√£ push ƒë∆∞·ª£c project l√™n github. Github cung c·∫•p cho ch√∫ng ta m·ªôt t√≠nh nƒÉng ƒë·ªÉ tri·ªÉn khai nh·ªØng ƒëo·∫°n code kia th√†nh trang blog c·ªßa b·∫°n. Github lo t·∫•t, tri·ªÉn khai, DNS, ‚Ä¶.. etc

Vi·ªác c·ªßa b·∫°n l√† tham kh·∫£o c·∫•u h√¨nh Page c·ªßa github: https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages

Step 7 - Remove repository name in github link

ƒê·∫øn ƒë√¢y th√¨ b·∫°n s·∫Ω th·∫•y link blog c·ªßa b·∫°n c√≥ h∆°i k√¨ k√¨. Ki·ªÉu blogcuatoi.gihub.com/myblog, c√°i path tr√πng v·ªõi repository name c·ªßa project c·ªßa b·∫°n th√†nh m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa path ƒë∆∞·ªùng d·∫´n. N√≥ h∆°i k√¨ c·ª•c v√† ƒë·ªÉ pro h∆°n, b·∫°n n√™n c·∫•u h√¨nh xo√° path ƒë√≥ ƒëi, chuy·ªÉn th√†nh ƒë√∫ng d·∫°ng domain blogcuatoi.github.com

To remove the repository name, you‚Äôll need to make it a User Page (or an Organization page). Create a repository named myusername.github.io, and commit your content to the master branch

See this help page for more information.

Refer: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44531269/is-there-a-way-to-remove-repository-name-from-github-page-link
